Header: FIFA eWorld Cup final kicks-off in London
Content: The FIFA eWorld Cup kicked-off in London, with competitors from all over the world doing battle on the virtual football pitch.The first day of competition saw Rounds 1-5 of the group stage, with high drama during the 40 games and a huge tally of 610 goals scored.Brazilian player Zezinho scored the most goals on the day, with 32 in total. Germany’s MoAuba was close behind with 31.Friday’s opener leaves everything set-up for day two on Saturday where the group stage will come to an end. The top four players from each group will then advance to the knockouts on Sunday when the competition ends.
